Reviews.Title: Blackberry 8700g Unlocked Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: J Money
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, AT&T; is my carrier and I don't particularly care for them (but that is a completely different story). I bought this phone because the free phone that AT&T; gave me had almost no signal everywhere that I went (including my house) and the battery life depleted very quickly. So I was just looking for a cheap replacement until my contract is up and I can switch carriers. This phone does exactly what I want it to do and NOTHING more (no camera, no micro SD slot, nothing fancy). I don't have a data plan currently so I can't say anything about browsing the web. But this phone does have a very consistently strong signal and now I don't drop anymore phone calls. This phone is fairly easy to text with but, the buttons feel kind of cheap and there are a lot of sub menus ( and I do mean very many sub menus). So all in all, it was a solid purchase and I feel like I got my money's worth. Not the most convenient phone ever but a good backup to keep around in case I drop a better phone into a puddle or something.

Reviews.Content: I knew it was a used product, and it works very well, many thanks for the item.I will stongly recomend this Phone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for busy people
Reviews.Author: Alex Souther
Reviews.Content: So this phone came out a while ago (in phone years)Long story short, the battery contacts wonked out on my newer blackberry, and I needed a phone ASAP so I ordered this one.It is incredible. The size is perfect as compared to thinner phones, because I can rest it between my ear and my shoulder when having a phone conversation. The qwerty keyboard provides excellent tactile and auditory feedback, and I can type with ease on it. The screen has a hard plastic over it that I would never imagine breaking through normal wear and tear. The side has a scroll wheel which makes navigation easy and efficient (no rubbing the little box or clicking just next to a link anymore)The biggest selling point would be the battery life, though. I bought this phone USED and the battery lasted on a full charge for 2 days. Note that I used the internet, receive and send text messages, and make phone calls practically all day between work and school. I still had a good chunk of battery left before I put it on the charger. I cannot recall owning a phone with such a good battery life in my phone-using days (I have owned a samsung t209, a nokia flip phone, samsung gravity I and II, g1, sidekick 4g, and the latest curve)
